specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Personal Data Access, Reversal, Rectification and Deletion
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to enable data subjects to request access to, modification, or deletion of their personal data, according to any applicable laws and regulations.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Data Retention and Deletion
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Data retention, archiving and deletion is managed in accordance with business requirements, applicable laws and regulations.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Data Encryption
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Provide cryptographic protection to data at-rest and in-transit, using cryptographic libraries certified to approved standards.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Encryption Algorithm
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Use encryption algorithms that are appropriate for data protection, considering the classification of data, associated risks, and usability of the encryption technology.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Data Location
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to specify and document the physical locations of data, including any locations in which data is processed or backed up.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Secure Interoperability and Portability Management
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Implement cryptographically secure and standardized network protocols for the management, import and export of data.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Data Portability Contractual Obligations
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Agreements must include provisions specifying CSCs access to data upon contract termination and will include: a. Data format b. Length of time the data will be stored c. Scope of the data retained and made available to the CSCs d. Data deletion policy

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Sensitive Data Transfer
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures that ensure any transfer of personal or sensitive data is protected from unauthorized access and only processed within scope as permitted by the respective laws and regulations.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Storage Encryption
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Protect information from unauthorized disclosure on managed endpoint devices with storage encryption.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Data Loss Prevention
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Configure managed endpoints with Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies and rules in accordance with a risk assessment.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Backup
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Periodically backup data stored in the cloud. Ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the backup, and verify data restoration from backup for resiliency.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Endpoint Inventory
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Maintain an inventory of all endpoints used to store and access company data.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Endpoint Management
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to enforce policies and controls for all endpoints permitted to access systems and/or store, transmit, or process organizational data.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Software Firewalls
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Configure managed endpoints with properly configured software firewalls.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Application Security Baseline Requirements
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Establish, document and maintain baseline requirements for securing different applications.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Secure Application Design and Development
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define and implement a SDLC process for application design, development, deployment, and operation in accordance with security requirements defined by the organization.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Network Security
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Monitor, encrypt and restrict communications between environments to only authenticated and authorized connections, as justified by the business. Review these configurations at least annually, and support them by a documented justification of all allowed services, protocols, ports, and compensating controls.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Application Interface Availability
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Provide application interface(s) to CSCs so that they programmatically retrieve their data to enable interoperability and portability.

specs:capability.name: Secure Data and Virtual Machine Migration

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Migration to Cloud Environments
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Use secure and encrypted communication channels when migrating servers, services, applications, or data to cloud environments. Such channels must include only up-to-date and approved protocols.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Identity Inventory
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Manage, store, and review the information of system identities, and level of access.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Separation of Duties
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Employ the separation of duties principle when implementing informationsystem access.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Least Privilege
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Employ the separation of duties principle when implementing information system access.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: User Access Review
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Review and revalidate user access for least privilege and separation of duties with a frequency that is commensurate with organizational risk tolerance.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Segregation of Privileged Access Roles
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the segregation of privileged access roles such that administrative access to data, encryption and key management capabilities and logging capabilities are distinct and separated.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Safeguard Logs Integrity
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to ensure the logging infrastructure is read-only for all with write access, including privileged access roles, and that the ability to disable it is controlled through a procedure that ensures the segregation of duties and break glass procedures.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Strong Authentication
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for authenticating access to systems, application and data assets, including multifactor authentication for at least privileged user and sensitive data access. Adopt digital certificates or alternatives which achieve an equivalent level of security for system identities.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Password Management
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the secure management of passwords.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Authorization Mechanisms
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to verify access to data and system functions is authorized.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Roles and Responsabilities
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define and implement cryptographic, encryption and key management roles and responsibilities.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Generation
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Generate Cryptographic keys using industry accepted cryptographic libraries specifying the algorithm strength and the random number generator used.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Purpose
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Manage cryptographic secret and private keys that are provisioned for a unique purpose.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Rotation
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Rotate cryptographic keys in accordance with the calculated cryptoperiod, which includes provisions for considering the risk of information disclosure and legal and regulatory requirements.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Revocation
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to revoke and remove cryptographic keys prior to the end of its established cryptoperiod, when a key is compromised, or an entity is no longer part of the organization, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Destruction
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to destroy keys stored outside a secure environment and revoke keys stored in Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) when they are no longer needed, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Activation
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to create keys in a pre-activated state when they have been generated but not authorized for use, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Suspension
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to monitor, review and approve key transitions from any state to/from suspension, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Key Inventory Management
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures in order for the key management system to track and report all cryptographic materials and changes in status, which include provisions for legal and regulatory requirements.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Log Protection
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: The information system protects audit records from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Encryption Monitoring and Reporting
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Establish and maintain a monitoring and internal reporting capability over the operations of cryptographic, encryption and key management policies, processes, procedures, and controls.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Transaction/Activity Logging
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Log and monitor key lifecycle management events to enable auditing and reporting on usage of cryptographic keys.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Access Control Logs
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Monitor and log physical access using an auditable access control system.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Failures And Anomalies Reporting
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the reporting of anomalies and failures of the monitoring system and provide immediate notification to the accountable party.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Independent Assessments
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Conduct independent audit and assurance assessments according to relevant standards at least annually.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Risk Based Planning Assessment
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Perform independent audit and assurance assessments according to risk-based plans and policies.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Audit Management Process
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define and implement an Audit Management process to support audit planning, risk analysis, security control assessment, conclusion, remediation schedules, report generation, and review of past reports and supporting evidence.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Remediation
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate and maintain a risk-based corrective action plan to remediate audit findings, review and report remediation status to relevant stakeholders.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Secure Disposal
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Apply industry accepted methods for the secure disposal of data from storage media such that data is not recoverable by any forensic means.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Data classification
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Classify data according to its type and sensitivity level.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Sensitiver Data Protection
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define and implement, processes, procedures and technical measures to protect sensitive data throughout it's lifecycle.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Security Monitoring and Alerting
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Identify and monitor security-related events within applications and the underlying infrastructure. Define and implement a system to generate alerts to responsible stakeholders based on such events and corresponding metrics.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Detection Updates
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to update detection tools, threat signatures, and indicators of compromise on a weekly, or more frequent basis.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Vulnerability Identification
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the detection of vulnerabilities on organizationally managed assets at least monthly.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Vulnerability Priorization
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Use a risk-based model for effective prioritization of vulnerability remediation using an industry recognized framework.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Penetration Testing
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the periodic performance of penetration testing by independent third parties.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Penetration Testing
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the periodic performance of penetration testing by independent third parties.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Vulnerability Management Reporting
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define and implement a process for tracking and reporting vulnerability identification and remediation activities that includes stakeholder notification.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Failures and Anomalies Reporting
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures for the reporting of anomalies and failures of the monitoring system and provide immediate notification to the accountable party.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Vulnerability Remediation Schedule
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Define, implement and evaluate processes, procedures and technical measures to enable both scheduled and emergency responses to vulnerability identifications, based on the identified risk.

specs:CCMsecurityControl.name: Vulnerability Management Metrics
specs:CCMsecurityControl.ccm:description: Establish, monitor and report metrics for vulnerability identification and remediation at defined intervals.
